entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character of the story, who is being celebrated by the crowd for winning a game.

entities.name: hagrid
entities.description: A gamekeeper at Hogwarts, who is excited about Harry's win and wants to tell Buckbeak about it.

entities.name: percy
entities.description: A member of the Weasley family, who is jumping up and down in excitement after Harry's win.

entities.name: professor mcgonagall
entities.description: A teacher at Hogwarts, who is sobbing with joy after Harry's win.

entities.name: wood
entities.description: The opposing team's captain, who is also celebrating Harry's win and passing the Quidditch Cup to him.

entities.name: buckbeak
entities.description: A hippogriff that Hagrid wants to tell about Harry's win.

entities.name: ron and hermione
entities.description: Harry's friends, who are fighting their way through the crowd to reach him after his win.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: The headmaster of Hogwarts, who is waiting with the Quidditch Cup for Harry to lift it.

relationships.description: The crowd is celebrating Harry's win, as evident from the text where they are pouring over the barriers onto the field and hoisting him onto their shoulders.
Hagrid wants to tell Buckbeak about Harry's win, as mentioned in the text where he says 'Wait till I tell Buckbeak!'
Ron and Hermione are fighting their way through the crowd to reach Harry after his win, as mentioned in the text where it says 'There, Ô¨Åghting their way toward Harry...'
Wood is passing the Quidditch Cup to Harry after his win, as mentioned in the text where it says 'As a sobbing Wood passed Harry the Cup...'
Dumbledore is waiting with the Quidditch Cup for Harry to lift it, as mentioned in the text where it says '...where Dumbledore stood waiting with the enormous Quidditch Cup.'
